an5.128:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five kinds of suffering for an ascetic.
an5.128:4.3: It’s when a mendicant is not content with any kind of robe, alms-food, lodging, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick. And they live the spiritual life dissatisfied.
an5.128:4.4: These are five kinds of suffering for an ascetic.
an5.128:5.1: There are these five kinds of happiness for an ascetic.
an5.128:5.3: It’s when a mendicant is content with any kind of robe, alms-food, lodging, and medicinal requisites and supports for the sick. And they live the spiritual life satisfied.
an5.128:5.4: These are five kinds of happiness for an ascetic.”
